intro: Wachendorfia elata, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Wachendorfia elata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
